inputs.remark: 应该为三次 visit；QuickSIN 从 V1 移到 V2 和 V3。

logic_summary: Split investigations into three visits (V1, V2, V3) as per remarks.
V1: Retained initial audiometric and immittance tests; removed QuickSIN.
V2: Added visit for hearing aid fitting; moved unaided QuickSIN results here.
V3: Added visit for follow-up; added aided QuickSIN results here.

value.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with bilateral, generally mild, sloping sensorineural hearing loss. Word recognition in quiet is excellent. Middle ear function is normal.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Slight SNHL 250-3000 Hz, sloping to mild at 4000 Hz. Left ear: Normal to slight SNHL 250-2000 Hz, sloping to moderate at 6000 Hz.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRTs (25 dB HL AU) consistent with pure tones. WRS excellent (96% AD, 100% AS).

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal ear canal volume, static compliance, and middle ear pressure bilaterally (Type A).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Present and normal for ipsilateral and contralateral stimulation at 500-4000 Hz. Decay negative.

value.collective_interpretation: Unaided QuickSIN testing performed prior to fitting reveals a severe signal-to-noise ratio loss, correlating with the patient's chief complaint.

tests.name: Speech-in-noise
tests.result_summary: QuickSIN unaided SNR loss average 18.17 dB, indicating severe SNR loss.

value.collective_interpretation: Aided QuickSIN testing at the 2-week follow-up reveals significant improvement.

tests.name: Speech-in-noise
tests.result_summary: Aided QuickSIN SNR loss of 2.98 dB (mild), representing a 15.19 dB improvement over the unaided score.
